Question: These texts, as opposed to this person's lost works, are technical philosophical treatises from within this person's school.
Hints: Others, such as On Colors, may have been produced by this person's successors at the Lyceum, e.g., Theophrastus and Straton.
This person encouraged Alexander toward eastern conquest, and his attitude towards Persia was unabashedly ethnocentric.
All aspects of this person's philosophy continue to be the object of active academic study today.
